alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Grimes; Houston; Madison; Montgomery; Polk; San Jacinto; Trinity; Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 11:02PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will produce strong wind gusts across portions of Trinity, northern Grimes, northeastern Brazos, northwestern Montgomery, northwestern San Jacinto, central Houston, Madison, northern Polk and Walker Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hudson to 11 miles west of Trinity to near Wixon Valley. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern College Station, northeastern Bryan, Huntsville, Madisonville, Apple Springs, Trinity, Onalaska, Corrigan, Groveton, Point Blank, Lovelady, Riverside, Bedias, Kurten, Wixon Valley, Sebastopol, Iola, Crabbs Prairie, Pennington and North Zulch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brazos; Grimes; Houston; Madison; Montgomery; Polk; San Jacinto; Trinity; Walker
